alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 11:02PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Greenbrier and northeastern Summers Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1102 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alderson, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg... White Sulphur Springs... Alderson... Asbury... Greenbrier River Trail... Lewisburg Airport... and Lawn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
